publisher.value: HL7 International - Biomedical Research and Regulation Work Group

description.value: The PCORNet Facility Type contains the codes to be used by PCORNet data marts to represent the type of facility where care is delivered.

display.value: United States of America

definition.value: Covered facilities or locations
A facility whose primary purpose is education.

display.value: Mapped to CMS Place of Service Code - 09 and 21. Prison / Correctional Facility, Inpatient Hospital

definition.value: A prison, jail, reformatory, work farm, detention center, or any other similar facility maintained by either Federal, State or local authorities for the purpose of confinement or rehabilitation of adult or juvenile criminal offenders.

Location, other than a hospital, skilled nursing facility (SNF), military treatment facility, community health center, State or local public health clinic, or intermediate care facility (ICF), where the health professional routinely provides health examinations, diagnosis, and treatment of illness or injury on an ambulatory basis.

Location, other than a hospital, skilled nursing facility (SNF), military treatment facility, community health center, State or local public health clinic, or intermediate care facility (ICF), where the health professional routinely provides health examinations, diagnosis, and treatment of illness or injury on an ambulatory basis.

Location, other than a hospital, skilled nursing facility (SNF), military treatment facility, community health center, State or local public health clinic, or intermediate care facility (ICF), where the health professional routinely provides health examinations, diagnosis, and treatment of illness or injury on an ambulatory basis.

Location, other than a hospital, skilled nursing facility (SNF), military treatment facility, community health center, State or local public health clinic, or intermediate care facility (ICF), where the health professional routinely provides health examinations, diagnosis, and treatment of illness or injury on an ambulatory basis.

Location, other than a hospital, skilled nursing facility (SNF), military treatment facility, community health center, State or local public health clinic, or intermediate care facility (ICF), where the health professional routinely provides health examinations, diagnosis, and treatment of illness or injury on an ambulatory basis.
Location, other than a hospital or other facility, where the patient receives care in a private residence.

display.value: Mapped to CMS Place of Service Code - 13,14 and 32. Assisted Living Facility, Group Home, Nursing Facility

definition.value: Covered location for types of Residential Institutions.

display.value: Walk-in Retail Clinic

definition.value: A walk-in health clinic, other than an office, urgent care facility, pharmacy or independent clinic and not described by any other Place of Service code, that is located within a retail operation and provides, on an ambulatory basis, preventive and primary care services.

display.value: Mapped to CMS Place of Service Code - 19 and 22. Off-Campus - Outpatient Hospital, On Campus - Outpatient Hospital

definition.value: Off-Campus: A portion of an off-campus hospital provider based department which provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services to sick or injured persons who do not require hospitalization or institutionalization. On Campus: A portion of a hospital’s main campus which provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services to sick or injured persons who do not require hospitalization or institutionalization.

display.value: Mapped to CMS Place of Service Code - 19 and 22. Off-Campus - Outpatient Hospital, On Campus - Outpatient Hospital

On Campus: A portion of a hospital’s main campus which provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services to sick or injured persons who do not require hospitalization or institutionalization.

On Campus: A portion of a hospital’s main campus which provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services to sick or injured persons who do not require hospitalization or institutionalization.

display.value: Inpatient Hospital

definition.value: A facility, other than psychiatric, which primarily provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services by, or under, the supervision of physicians to patients admitted for a variety of medical conditions.

display.value: Inpatient Hospital

definition.value: A facility, other than psychiatric, which primarily provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services by, or under, the supervision of physicians to patients admitted for a variety of medical conditions.

display.value: Inpatient Hospital

definition.value: A facility, other than psychiatric, which primarily provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services by, or under, the supervision of physicians to patients admitted for a variety of medical conditions.

display.value: Inpatient Hospital

definition.value: A facility, other than psychiatric, which primarily provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services by, or under, the supervision of physicians to patients admitted for a variety of medical conditions.

display.value: Inpatient Hospital

definition.value: A facility, other than psychiatric, which primarily provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services by, or under, the supervision of physicians to patients admitted for a variety of medical conditions.

display.value: Inpatient Hospital

definition.value: A facility, other than psychiatric, which primarily provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services by, or under, the supervision of physicians to patients admitted for a variety of medical conditions.

display.value: Inpatient Hospital

definition.value: A facility, other than psychiatric, which primarily provides diagnostic, therapeutic (both surgical and nonsurgical), and rehabilitation services by, or under, the supervision of physicians to patients admitted for a variety of medical conditions.

display.value: Emergency Room - Hospital

definition.value: A portion of a hospital where emergency diagnosis and treatment of illness or injury is provided.

display.value: Ambulatory Surgical Center

definition.value: A freestanding facility, other than a physician's office, where surgical and diagnostic services are provided on an ambulatory basis.

display.value: Ambulatory Surgical Center

definition.value: A freestanding facility, other than a physician's office, where surgical and diagnostic services are provided on an ambulatory basis.

display.value: Birthing Center

definition.value: A facility, other than a hospital's maternity facilities or a physician's office, which provides a setting for labor, delivery, and immediate post-partum care as well as immediate care of new born infants.

display.value: Skilled Nursing Facility

definition.value: A facility which primarily provides inpatient skilled nursing care and related services to patients who require medical, nursing, or rehabilitative services but does not provide the level of care or treatment available in a hospital.
A facility, other than a patient's home, in which palliative and supportive care for terminally ill patients and their families are provided.

display.value: Ambulance - Land

definition.value: A land vehicle specifically designed, equipped and staffed for lifesaving and transporting the sick or injured.

display.value: Ambulance - Air or Water

definition.value: A portion of a hospital where emergency diagnosis and treatment of illness or injury is provided.

display.value: Ambulance - Air or Water

definition.value: A portion of a hospital where emergency diagnosis and treatment of illness or injury is provided.

display.value: Mapped to CMS Place of Service Code - 50 and 71. Federally Qualified Health Center, Public Health Clinic

definition.value: A facility located in a medically underserved area that provides Medicare beneficiaries preventive primary medical care under the general direction of a physician. facility maintained by either State or local health departments that provides ambulatory primary medical care under the general direction of a physician.

display.value: Mapped to CMS Place of Service Code - 51 and 52. Inpatient Psychiatric Facility, Psychiatric Facility - Partial Hospitalization

definition.value: A facility that provides inpatient psychiatric services for the diagnosis and treatment of mental illness on a 24-hour basis, by or under the supervision of a physician. A facility for the diagnosis and treatment of mental illness that provides a planned therapeutic program for patients who do not require full time hospitalization, but who need broader programs than are possible from outpatient visits to a hospital-based or hospital-affiliated facility.

display.value: Psychiatric Facility - Partial Hospitalization

definition.value: A facility for the diagnosis and treatment of mental illness that provides a planned therapeutic program for patients who do not require full time hospitalization, but who need broader programs than are possible from outpatient visits to a hospital-based or hospital-affiliated facility.

display.value: Community Mental Health Center

definition.value: A facility that provides the following services: outpatient services, including specialized outpatient services for children, the elderly, individuals who are chronically ill, and residents of the CMHC's mental health services area who have been discharged from inpatient treatment at a mental health facility; 24 hour a day emergency care services; day treatment, other partial hospitalization services, or psychosocial rehabilitation services; screening for patients being considered for admission to State mental health facilities to determine the appropriateness of such admission; and consultation and education services.

display.value: Mapped to CMS Place of Service Code - 55 and 57. Residential Substance Abuse Treatment Facility, Non-residential Substance Abuse Treatment Facility

definition.value: Covered location for SUBSTANCE_ABUSE_TREATMENT_CENTER

display.value: Mass Immunization Center

definition.value: A location where providers administer pneumococcal pneumonia and influenza virus vaccinations and submit these services as electronic media claims, paper claims, or using the roster billing method. This generally takes place in a mass immunization setting, such as, a public health center, pharmacy, or mall but may include a physician office setting.

display.value: Comprehensive Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility

definition.value: A facility that provides comprehensive rehabilitation services under the supervision of a physician to inpatients with physical disabilities. Services include physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech pathology, social or psychological services, and orthotics and prosthetics services.

display.value: Comprehensive Outpatient Rehabilitation Facility

definition.value: A facility that provides comprehensive rehabilitation services under the supervision of a physician to outpatients with physical disabilities. Services include physical therapy, occupational therapy, and speech pathology services.

display.value: End-Stage Renal Disease Treatment Facility

definition.value: A facility other than a hospital, which provides dialysis treatment, maintenance, and/or training to patients or caregivers on an ambulatory or home-care basis.

display.value: Rural Health Clinic

definition.value: A certified facility which is located in a rural medically underserved area that provides ambulatory primary medical care under the general direction of a physician.

display.value: Independent Laboratory

definition.value: A laboratory certified to perform diagnostic and/or clinical tests independent of an institution or a physician's office.
